alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Dallas; Greene; Hale; Lowndes; Marengo; Perry; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:37AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Autauga, northern Marengo, southern Perry, southern Greene, southwestern Hale, northwestern Lowndes, central Dallas and central Sumter Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1237 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Paul M Grist State Park to near Faunsdale to near Boyd. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Selma, Demopolis, Valley Grande, Marion, Livingston, York, Uniontown, Selmont-West Selmont, Jefferson, Autaugaville, White Hall, Forkland, Orrville, Epes, Newbern, Faunsdale, Emelle, Dayton, Benton and Bogue Chitto. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Autauga; Dallas; Greene; Hale; Lowndes; Marengo; Perry; Sumter
